description: Closed relation sets for eVTOL knowledge graph construction. These enums ensure consistent LLM extraction across all document types.

company_tech.develops: Company is building, engineering, or creating the technology
company_tech.uses: Company is operating or deploying the technology in production
company_tech.invests_in: Company provides financial investment for technology development
company_tech.researches: Company conducts academic or R&D research on the technology
company_tech.owns_ip: Company holds patents or intellectual property for the technology

tech_tech.competes_with: Technologies are direct competitors solving the same problem
tech_tech.alternative_to: Technology offers a different approach to the same problem
tech_tech.enables: Technology makes another technology possible or functional
tech_tech.supersedes: Technology replaces or improves upon older technology
tech_tech.complements: Technologies work together or enhance each other
tech_tech.requires: Technology needs another technology to function (hard dependency)
tech_tech.supports: Technology helps another technology work better (soft dependency)
tech_tech.advances_beyond: Technology improves over or advances a previous technology
tech_tech.contradicts: Technology challenges or disproves assumptions of another technology
tech_tech.extends_life_of: Technology improves durability, lifetime, or longevity of another
tech_tech.improves_performance_of: Technology enhances capability, throughput, or effectiveness of another
tech_tech.improves_efficiency_of: Technology reduces losses, waste, or resource consumption in another
tech_tech.builds_on: Technology is based on or extends prior foundational work
tech_tech.validates: Research or testing validates claims, performance, or viability of technology

company_company.invests_in: Financial investment (VC, strategic investment, or funding)
company_company.acquires: Merger, acquisition, or purchase of company
company_company.competes_with: Direct business competition in the same market

document_document.cites: Document references another document (patent or paper citation)
document_document.cited_by: Document is referenced by another (reverse citation, computed)

extraction_notes.synonym_normalization: LLM may output 'builds' or 'creates' â†’ normalize to 'develops'
extraction_notes.evidence_required: Every relation must include evidence_text (max 200 chars)
extraction_notes.confidence_scoring: Agent 2 computes confidence based on evidence_count across documents
extraction_notes.validation: Use validate_llm_output() to ensure relations match allowed enums

layer_1_innovation: Tech-Tech: enables, supersedes, advances_beyond, builds_on (innovation trajectories)
layer_4_narrative: All relations extracted from news articles

phase_1_core.rationale: Most common relations, test LLM extraction pipeline. Citation networks critical for Layer 1.

phase_2_extended.rationale: Supply chain, research validation, and performance benchmarking for multi-layer analysis

phase_3_complete.rationale: Full schema implementation with all competitive, evolution, and financial relations
